com.microsoft.windowsazure.management.sql

Interface DatabaseOperations

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DatabaseOperationsImpl

    public interface DatabaseOperations
    Represents all the operations for operating on Azure SQL Databases. Contains operations to: Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete databases, and also includes the ability to get the event logs for a database.

        DatabaseCreateResponse create(java.lang.String serverName,
                            DatabaseCreateParameters parameters)
                              throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                     org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                     javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
                                     java.io.IOException,
                                     ServiceException
        Creates a database in an Azure SQL Database Server.
        Parameters:
        serverName - Required. The name of the Azure SQL Database Server where the database will be created.
        parameters - Required. The parameters for the create database operation.
        Returns:
        Represents the response to a create database request from the service.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was an error configuring the parser for the response body.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the response body.
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - Thrown if there was an error creating the DOM transformer.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
